data.title: Upon further review Robert Christgau reviews suck
data.meta_description: I guess you have to respect everyones opinion, but I was looking at some of Robert Christgau aka 'The Dean of Rock Critics' reviews and here is what he gave some well known albums Pearl Jam-Ten B- Radiohead OK Computer B- Radiohead The Bends C Pearl Jam No Code * (apparently he went away from letter grades for this) Pearl Jam VS.
data.text:
I guess you have to respect everyones opinion, but I was looking at some of Robert Christgau aka 'The Dean of Rock Critics' reviews and here is what he gave some well known albums

Pearl Jam-Ten B-

Radiohead OK Computer B-

Radiohead The Bends C

Pearl Jam No Code * (apparently he went away from letter grades for this)

Pearl Jam VS. a symbol of a bomb (don't know if this is good or bad)

Coldplay X&Y B (better than Ten and OK Computer)

Nirvana Nevermind & In Utero A (both better than Ten and OK)

Bruce Springsteen Born in the USA A+ (now it has gone too far an A+ for an album with I'm on Fire and Working on the Highway on it!? )

Good Charlotte-The Chronicles of Life and Death C+ (better than The Bends and slightly worse than Ten)

Good Charlotte- The Young and the Hopeless *** (back to stars, 3x better than No Code)

Guns & Roses- Use Your Illusion I * (see above to see the scale)

Guns & Roses- Use Your Illusion II- a pair of scissors (who knows what that means- if it is insulting it should be used for Good Charlotte and if it's a complement why scissors?)

Guns & Roses - Appetite for Destruction- B- (seriously)

So apparently this guy was made famous by giving A's and A+'s to every Beatles and Rolling Stones album and that made him The Dean of Rock, but upon further review this guy sucks ass.

Post edited by Unknown User on May 2008
